title: Broiled Sole Parmesan
summary: Broiled Sole Parmesan might be a good recipe to expand your main course recipe box. This recipe serves 1. Watching your figure? This gluten free and pescatarian recipe has 1272 calories, 103g of protein, and 92g of fat per serving. For $15.55 per serving, this recipe covers 42% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up lemon, lemon juice, green onions, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lemon you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 25 minutes. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. With a spoonacular score of 66%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes are Broiled Sole Parmesan, Broiled Sole With Parmesan-Olive Topping, and Broiled Sole With Mustard And Thyme.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Anne Amie Pinot Gris with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Anne Amie Pinot Gris
productMatches.description:
Aromas of Bartlett pear, gardenia, white peach, white tea, jasmine, graham cracker, and straw. Flavors of Asian pear, white fig, white peach, white strawberry, and fennel flowers. The finish is dry, long and acid driven.
Pairs well with roast chicken, Caesar salad, mussels, quince glazed pork chop, grilled squash, pan seared trout, and bibimbap.

instructions: Heat broiler.In medium bowl, stir together all ingredients except fish and lemon juice.Place sole fillets on broiler pan; sprinkle with lemon juice.Broil 3-4 inches from heat until fish flakes with a fork (about 3-5 minutes).Spread Parmesan mixture over fillets and broil until bubbly and golden brown (3-5 minutes).

steps.step: Heat broiler.In medium bowl, stir together all ingredients except fish and lemon juice.
Place sole fillets on broiler pan; sprinkle with lemon juice.Broil 3-4 inches from heat until fish flakes with a fork (about 3-5 minutes).
Spread Parmesan mixture over fillets and broil until bubbly and golden brown (3-5 minutes).
